questions.question: What technique balances datasets by generating synthetic minority samples?
questions.explanation: SMOTE creates artificial samples for underrepresented classes.

questions.question: What method assigns integers to categorical values in order?
questions.explanation: Label encoding converts categories to sequential numbers.

questions.question: What technique creates binary columns for each category?
questions.explanation: One-hot encoding represents categories as binary vectors.

questions.question: What method uses surrounding values to fill missing data?
questions.explanation: Interpolation estimates missing values based on neighboring data points.

questions.question: What statistical method detects outliers using quartiles?
questions.explanation: The IQR method identifies outliers beyond 1.5 times the interquartile range.

questions.question: What technique reduces features while preserving variance?
questions.explanation: PCA transforms data into uncorrelated principal components.

questions.question: What resampling method reduces majority class samples?
questions.explanation: Undersampling balances datasets by removing majority class instances.

questions.question: What method handles missing data by removing incomplete rows?
questions.explanation: Listwise deletion drops all rows with any missing values.

questions.question: What technique normalizes by subtracting mean and dividing by standard deviation?
questions.explanation: Z-score normalization creates mean 0 and standard deviation 1.
